snippet: A prosecutor said that shortcomings had been found in the case against Amir Mirzaei Hekmati, and that a new trial would be held.
abstract: Supreme Court of Iran tosses out death penalty conviction of former American Marine Amir Mirzaei Hekmati, who is accused of spying, and orders a retrial in a separate court; case has become a source of friction between the United States and Iran, coming against the backdrop of their increasing confrontation over Iran's disputed nuclear program.

byline.contributor: Artin Afkhami contributed reporting from Boston.

lead_paragraph: A prosecutor said that shortcomings had been found in the case against Amir Mirzaei Hekmati, and that a new trial would be held.

headline.seo: Iranian Court Overturns Marine’s Death Sentence in Spy Case
headline.main: Iranian Court Orders Retrial for American in Spy Case
headline.print_headline: Iranian Court Orders Retrial For American In Spy Case
